pr_title: DDR Back compatible for TLH enable/disable change

timeline.message:
DDR Back compatible for TLH enable/disable change

	TLH enabling/disabling has been changed by using realHeapTop
	instead of realHeapAlloc for faking TLH full, so old core file
	only contains realHeapAlloc and new core file only contains
	realHeapTop. Update DDR to support analyzing old core file too.

	GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V1 for old core support
	GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V2 for the latest core support

Signed-off-by: Lin Hu <linhu@ca.ibm.com>

	GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V2 for the latest core support

Signed-off-by: Lin Hu <linhu@ca.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: This won't compile: there's no (generated) method named realHeapAlloc in current builds.
timeline.author: keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: This must declare that it throws CorruptDataException.
timeline.author: keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: This must declare that it throws CorruptDataException.
timeline.author: keithc-ca
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 1991, 2020 IBM Corp. and others
+ *
+ * This program and the accompanying materials are made available under
+ * the terms of the Eclipse Public License 2.0 which accompanies this
+ * distribution and is available at https://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0/
+ * or the Apache License, Version 2.0 which accompanies this distribution and
+ * is available at https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.
+ *
+ * This Source Code may also be made available under the following
+ * Secondary Licenses when the conditions for such availability set
+ * forth in the Eclipse Public License, v. 2.0 are satisfied: GNU
+ * General Public License, version 2 with the GNU Classpath
+ * Exception [1] and GNU General Public License, version 2 with the
+ * OpenJDK Assembly Exception [2].
+ *
+ * [1] https://www.gnu.org/software/classpath/license.html
+ * [2] http://openjdk.java.net/legal/assembly-exception.html
+ *
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 OR Apache-2.0 OR GPL-2.0 WITH Classpath-exception-2.0 OR LicenseRef-GPL-2.0 WITH Assembly-exception
+ *******************************************************************************/
+package com.ibm.j9ddr.vm29.j9.gc;
+
+import com.ibm.j9ddr.CorruptDataException;
+import com.ibm.j9ddr.vm29.pointer.U8Pointer;
+import com.ibm.j9ddr.vm29.pointer.generated.J9VMThreadPointer;
+
+import java.util.ArrayList;
+
+class GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V2 extends GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V1 {
+
+	protected GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V2(U8Pointer base, U8Pointer top, boolean includeLiveObjects, boolean includeDeadObjects) throws CorruptDataException
+	{
+		super(base, top, includeLiveObjects, includeDeadObjects);
+	}
+
+	@Override
+	protected void addExcludedRangeForDisablingTLHOrSamplingCase(boolean nonZeroTLH, J9VMThreadPointer vmThread, U8Pointer base, U8Pointer top, U8Pointer heapAlloc, U8Pointer heapTop, ArrayList<U8Pointer[]> excludedRangeList)

	instead of realHeapAlloc for faking TLH full, so old core file
	only contains realHeapAlloc and new core file only contains
	realHeapTop. Update DDR to support analyzing old core file too.

	GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V1 for old core support
	GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V2 for the latest core support

timeline.bodyText:
I suggest the first two parameters be replaced by J9ModronThreadLocalHeapPointer heap and the callers can
provide  vmThread.nonZeroAllocateThreadLocalHeap() or vmThread.allocateThreadLocalHeap() as appropriate.
Even better, extract (and only override) a method that only accesses realHeapAlloc or realHeapTop as appropriate: the call to adjustedToRange and all that follows is common to both cases.
timeline.author: keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: This should cache the method rather than query for it each time.
timeline.author: keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText:
None of these exceptions should be ignored.
CorruptDataException should not be caught.
InvocationTargetException should be handled by throwing the target exception (which might be CorruptDataException).
timeline.author: keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: This change is not needed if the changes suggested above are implemented.
timeline.author: keithc-ca
keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: Why does this need both realHeapAlloc and realHeapTop? Only one will be present except in a very small number of interim builds that I think we can safely ignore.
timeline.author: keithc-ca

replies.bodyText: we fake heapAlloc for disabling inline cache in old core file and fake heapTop in new core file, in case we scan the TLH for gccheck during disabling inline TLH, we need to skip scanning between realHeapAlloc to heapTop for old core and skip scanning between heapAlloc and realHeapTop for new core, in order to make most code transparent between old core(V1) and new core(V2), getRealHeapAlloc() and getRealHeapTop() return realHeapAlloc and HeapTop in V1 and return heapAlloc and realHeapTop in V2.
replies.author: LinHu2016

replies.bodyText: It took me a while, but I think I get it now. Thanks.
replies.author: keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: The default should be U8Pointer.NULL (callers are not expecting null to be returned).
timeline.author: keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: It's not reasonable to classify these as CorruptDataException.
timeline.author: keithc-ca

replies.bodyText: On second thought, perhaps CorruptDataException is the right response. If the core file says it's the old variety, but doesn't have the corresponding field (which would lead to NoSuchMethodException here), then it is, in fact, corrupt.
replies.author: keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: If e4.getTargetException() is a CorruptDataException or a RuntimeException, that should be thrown instead.
timeline.author: keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: Please don't add trailing whitespace (in fact, I support removing it elsewhere).
timeline.author: keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: I suggest the call to adjustedToRange should occur in the caller.
timeline.author: keithc-ca

+ * Secondary Licenses when the conditions for such availability set
+ * forth in the Eclipse Public License, v. 2.0 are satisfied: GNU
+ * General Public License, version 2 with the GNU Classpath

+ * OpenJDK Assembly Exception [2].
+ *
+ * [1] https://www.gnu.org/software/classpath/license.html
+ * [2] http://openjdk.java.net/legal/assembly-exception.html
+ *
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 OR Apache-2.0 OR GPL-2.0 WITH Classpath-exception-2.0 OR LicenseRef-GPL-2.0 WITH Assembly-exception
+ *******************************************************************************/
+package com.ibm.j9ddr.vm29.j9.gc;
+
+import com.ibm.j9ddr.CorruptDataException;
+import com.ibm.j9ddr.vm29.pointer.U8Pointer;
+import com.ibm.j9ddr.vm29.pointer.generated.J9ModronThreadLocalHeapPointer;
+
+import java.util.ArrayList;
+
+class GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V2 extends GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V1 {
+
+	protected GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V2(U8Pointer base, U8Pointer top, boolean includeLiveObjects, boolean includeDeadObjects) throws CorruptDataException
+	{
+		super(base, top, includeLiveObjects, includeDeadObjects);
+	}
+
+	@Override
+	protected U8Pointer getRealHeapTop(J9ModronThreadLocalHeapPointer threadLocalHeap, U8Pointer heapTop, U8Pointer base, U8Pointer top) throws CorruptDataException
+	{
+		return adjustedToRange(threadLocalHeap.realHeapTop(), base, top);

timeline.message:
DDR Back compatible for TLH enable/disable change

	TLH enabling/disabling has been changed by using realHeapTop
	instead of realHeapAlloc for faking TLH full, so old core file
	only contains realHeapAlloc and new core file only contains
	realHeapTop. Update DDR to support analyzing old core file too.

	GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V1 for old core support
	GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V2 for the latest core support

Signed-off-by: Lin Hu <linhu@ca.ibm.com>

	realHeapTop. Update DDR to support analyzing old core file too.

	GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V1 for old core support
	GCObjectHeapIteratorAddressOrderedList_V2 for the latest core support

Signed-off-by: Lin Hu <linhu@ca.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: If cause is a RuntimeException or an Error, it should be thrown instead.

keithc-ca

timeline.bodyText: This should just throw cd; instead of calling raiseCorruptDataEvent().

timeline.bodyText:
This local variable is no longer useful; please just inline into the return statement:
  return (U8Pointer) realHeapAllocMethod.invoke(threadLocalHeap);
